searchDocs.title: What It Does​
searchDocs.content: Integrates seamlessly with Fusion reactive statesDetects changes efficiently using DeltaTableSupports path-based observation for nested table ("Currency.Gold")

searchDocs.title: What It’s Not​
searchDocs.content: Not a replacement for FusionNot for plain tables — use ReplicaNot a networking solution

searchDocs.title: Quick Start​
searchDocs.content: local Fusion = require("Fusion") local PathWatcher = require("PathWatcher") local scope = Fusion.scoped() local playerData = scope:Value({ Currency = { Gold = 100, Cash = 500 }, Level = 5, Inventory = { Weapons = {}, Potions = {} } }) -- Observe specific path local goldObserver = PathWatcher.new(playerData, "Currency.Gold") -- Reactive UI example local goldLabel = scope:New("TextLabel")({ Text = scope:Computed(function() return "Gold: " .. tostring(goldObserver.Value:get()) end) }) -- Side effect example goldObserver:onChange(function(newValue, oldValue) print(`Gold changed: {oldValue} → {newValue}`) end) playerData:set({ Currency = { Gold = 200, Cash = 500 } }) -- Output: "Gold changed: 100 → 200" goldObserver:Destroy()

searchDocs.title: FAQ​
searchDocs.content: Q: Can I use this with plain tables? A: No — use Replica.  Q: Does it replace Fusion? A: No, it extends it for path-level observation.  Q: Why not use Fusion observers directly? A: This adds delta efficiency, path filtering, and old/new comparisons.  Q: Multiple paths? A: Yes — use newMultiple().  Q: Works on server? A: Yes, if Fusion runs server-side.  Q: Performance? A: Processes only modified paths, not entire states.

searchDocs.title: PathWatcher​
searchDocs.content: </> interface PathWatcher { Value: Fusion.Value<any>-- The reactive Fusion state containing the path's value get: () → any-- Get the current value snapshot onChange: (listener: ( newValue: any, oldValue: any ) → ()) → Connection-- Listen to changes with old/new values Destroy: () → ()-- Clean up the observer and internal resources }

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> PathWatcher.new( tableState: Fusion.Value<{any}>,-- Fusion reactive state containing the full table path: string | {string},-- Path to observe (e.g., "Currency.Gold" or {"Currency", "Gold"}) onUpdate: (( path: {string}, oldValue: any, newValue: any ) → ())?-- Optional callback when path changes ) → PathWatcher Creates a new path observer that monitors changes to a specific path in a Fusion reactive state. Uses DeltaTable for efficient change detection (only processes changed paths). Example: local observer = PathWatcher.new(playerDataState, "Currency.Gold") -- Use the reactive Value in UI scope:Computed(function() return observer.Value:get() end) -- Or use onChange for side effects observer:onChange(function(newValue, oldValue) print("Gold changed!") end)

searchDocs.title: newMultiple​
searchDocs.content: </> PathWatcher.newMultiple( tableState: Fusion.Value<{any}>,-- Fusion reactive state containing the full table paths: {string | {string}}-- Array of paths to observe ) → {[string]: PathWatcher}-- Dictionary mapping path strings to observers Creates multiple path observers at once for the same table state. Useful when you need to observe several paths efficiently. Example: local observers = PathWatcher.newMultiple(playerDataState, { "Currency.Gold", "Currency.Cash", "Level", "Kills" }) observers["Currency.Gold"]:onChange(function(newValue) print("Gold:", newValue) end) -- Clean up all for _, observer in observers do observer:Destroy() end

searchDocs.title: setDebug​
searchDocs.content: </> PathWatcher.setDebug(enabled: boolean) → () Enables or disables debug logging for the PathWatcher module.

searchDocs.title: Destroy​
searchDocs.content: </> PathWatcher.Destroy() → () Destroys the PathWatcher instance, cleaning up internal resources.
